description: Google Places API Web Service - a service from which with the help of the HTTP-request you can get information about the places defined in this API: organizations, geographic locations or landmarks.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from Google Developers Console.

args.name: latitude
args.info: The latitude of place.

args.name: longitude
args.info: The longitude of place.

args.name: radius
args.info: Distance in meters over which the results must be found. The maximum allowable range is 50 000 meters. Note that the radius parameter should not be used if the value rank_by = distance.

args.name: rank_by
args.info: Optional: The order of the results. The possible values are: prominence (the default) - the results are sorted by popularity. Priority is given to the ranking of the more famous sites located in a given area. At a certain place affect the rating in the Google index, the overall popularity and other factors. Distance - the results are sorted in order of proximity to the point specified in the parameter location. If you specify distance, you must also specify one or more parameters keyword, name, or type.

args.name: keyword
args.info: Optional: The word on which the search is conducted in all contents are indexed by Google for a given place, including the name, type, address, user reviews and third-party content.

args.name: language
args.info: Optional: The language code, which should be possible to return the results.

args.name: minimum_price
args.info: Optional: The price range, limiting the search results. Valid entries are from 0 (free) to 4 (most expensive).

args.name: maximum_price
args.info: Optional: The price range, limiting the search results. Valid entries are from 0 (free) to 4 (most expensive).

args.name: name
args.info: Optional: The space-separated words that are being sought in the names of places.

args.name: open_now
args.info: Optional: Limit search results to only those organizations (establishments) that are open at the time of sending the request.

args.name: type
args.info: Optional: limit search results to only those places whose type corresponds to at least one of these. Types should be separated by a vertical bar (type1 | type2 | etc).

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from Google Developers Console.

args.name: query
args.info: The phrase that is searched for, such as 'restaurant'.

args.name: latitude
args.info: Optional: The latitude of place.

args.name: longitude
args.info: Optional: The longitude of place.

args.name: radius
args.info: Optional: Distance in meters over which the results must be found. The maximum allowable range is 50 000 meters.

args.name: place_id
args.info: The unique text identifier, returned by the getNearbyPlaces method.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from Google Developers Console.

args.name: image_id
args.info: The unique text identifier 'photo_reference', returned by the getNearbyPlaces method.

args.name: max_width
args.info: Indicate the values in pixels for the maximum width of the returned image.

args.name: max_height
args.info: Indicate the values in pixels for the maximum width of the returned image.

args.name: apiKey
args.info: The api key obtained from Google Developers Console.

args.name: accuracy
args.info: The accuracy of the location of the signal (in meters), which is based on the request.

args.name: address
args.info: Indicate the values in pixels for the maximum width of the returned image.

args.name: language
args.info: The language in which the title is transferred to the place.

args.name: latitude
args.info: The latitude of place.

args.name: longitude
args.info: The longitude of place.

args.name: name
args.info: The full name of the place. No more than 255 characters.

args.name: phoneNumber
args.info: Optional: The phone number of the place.

args.name: types
args.info: The category to which this place.

args.name: website
args.info: Optional: The URL-address of the official web site of the place, such as home organization page.
